first_reading.title: Letter to Titus
first_reading.text:
[[Tt 1,1]]Paul, a slave of God and Apostle of Jesus Christ for the sake of the faith of God's chosen ones and the recognition of religious truth,
[[Tt 1,2]]in the hope of eternal life that God, who does not lie, promised before time began,
[[Tt 1,3]]who indeed at the proper time revealed his word in the proclamation with which I was entrusted by the command of God our savior,
[[Tt 1,4]]to Titus, my true child in our common faith: grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our savior.
[[Tt 1,5]]For this reason I left you in Crete so that you might set right what remains to be done and appoint presbyters in every town, as I directed you,
[[Tt 1,6]]on condition that a man be blameless, married only once, with believing children who are not accused of licentiousness or rebellious.
[[Tt 1,7]]For a bishop as God's steward must be blameless, not arrogant, not irritable, not a drunkard, not aggressive, not greedy for sordid gain,
[[Tt 1,8]]but hospitable, a lover of goodness, temperate, just, holy, and self-controlled,
[[Tt 1,9]]holding fast to the true message as taught so that he will be able both to exhort with sound doctrine and to refute opponents.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 24,1]]The LORD's are the earth and its fullness; 
the world and those who dwell in it.
[[Ps 24,2]]For he founded it upon the seas 
and established it upon the rivers.

[[Ps 24,3]]Who can ascend the mountain of the LORD? 
or who may stand in his holy place?
[[Ps 24,4a]]One whose hands are sinless, whose heart is clean,
[[Ps 24,4b]]who desires not what is vain.

[[Ps 24,5]]He shall receive a blessing from the LORD, 
a reward from God his savior.
[[Ps 24,6]]Such is the race that seeks for him, 
that seeks the face of the God of Jacob.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,1]]Jesus said to his disciples, "Things that cause sin will inevitably occur, but woe to the person through whom they occur.
[[Lc 17,2]]It would be better for him if a millstone were put around his neck and he be thrown into the sea than for him to cause one of these little ones to sin.
[[Lc 17,3]]Be on your guard! If your brother sins, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him.
[[Lc 17,4]]And if he wrongs you seven times in one day and returns to you seven times saying, 'I am sorry,' you should forgive him."
[[Lc 17,5]]And the apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith."
[[Lc 17,6]]The Lord replied, "If you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you would say to (this) mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it would obey you.
